p: Cinnamomum camphora (L.) Presl is a precious multi-functional tree species [ 12, 13], mainly distributed in the southern area of Yangtze River Basin in China [ 14]. The roots, stems, leaves, flowers and fruits of camphor are rich in natural camphor and ethereal oils, which are momentous industrial and pharmaceutical raw materials [ 15]. In addition, camphor plays a significant role in forest carbon sequestration, structure and function maintenance, and biodiversity conservation. Thus, exploring the impact of climate change on suitable habitats under different scenarios may be helpful to understand the superior economic value and ecological function of camphor [ 16].
